tool_description: Configures different access levels and security zones within the RBAC system to control resource accessibility based on sensitivity and clearance requirements.

access_level_name.description: Name for the access level configuration

security_clearance.description: Required security clearance: public, internal, confidential, restricted, classified

resource_categories.description: Categories of resources this access level applies to

error_messages: Access level name already exists: Choose a unique name for the access level.
Invalid security clearance: Use one of [public, internal, confidential, restricted, classified].
Invalid time restriction format: Time restrictions must be in HH:MM-HH:MM format.
Invalid IP restriction format: Provide valid IP addresses or CIDR notation.
Invalid session timeout: Timeout must be between 5 and 1440 minutes.
usage: Configure access levels by specifying access_level_name, security_clearance, and resource_categories. Add time_restrictions, ip_restrictions, and other security controls as needed.

access_level_id.description: Unique identifier for the access level

security_score.description: Security score from 1 to 100 based on restrictions

applicable_resources.description: Number of resources this access level applies to
